item.title: Michael Cohen expected to detail how Trump reimbursed him for hush money payment
item.dc:creator: Adam Reiss and Jillian Frankel and Gary Grumbach and Dareh Gregorian and Ryan Nobles and Vaughn Hillyard
item.description: Cohen is expected to delve into payments he said he received from Trump in return for hush money paid to Stormy Daniels in the closing days of the 2016 campaign.

media:content.media:text: Michael Cohen.
media:content.media:description: Michael Cohen in New York City in 2018.

item.title: Troop movement seen by U.S. suggests Israel could soon expand Rafah operations
item.dc:creator: Monica Alba and Courtney Kube and Gabe Gutierrez and Phil Helsel and Raf Sanchez and Reuters
item.description: The U.S. has seen recent troop movement that indicates Israel could expand operations in Rafah soon, but it has not made a formal assessment about whether a full-scale invasion is imminent, according to two U.S. officials.

media:content.media:text: Israeli Strikes Destroy Buildings In Rafah
media:content.media:description: Children watch as smoke billows from buildings during Israeli strikes east of Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Biden moves ahead on China tariff hikes that includes 100% increase on EVs
item.dc:creator: Gabe Gutierrez and Rae Wang
item.description: President Joe Biden will announce Tuesday that his administration is raising tariffs on $18 billion of Chinese exports, including electric vehicles, as the White House tries to fight what it says are unfair trade practices by its global competitor.

media:content.media:text: cina economy ev evs electric cars vehicles transport parking lot
media:content.media:description: Electric cars for export in Suzhou, in China's eastern Jiangsu Province, on April 16.

item.title: Caitlin Clark ready take the WNBA by storm: 'This is what you've worked for'
item.dc:creator: David K. Li
item.description: Caitlin Clark's much-anticipated professional debut tips off Tuesday in Connecticut as the WNBA seeks to capitalize on unprecedented public interest.

item.title: Orcas sink yacht with 2 aboard in Strait of Gibraltar
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: An unknown number of orcas have sunk a sailing yacht after ramming it in Moroccan waters in the Strait of Gibraltar, Spain’s maritime rescue service said on Monday.

media:content.media:text: Underwater view of a female orca splashing through the water after it has gone up to breath, Pacific Ocean, New Zealand.
media:content.media:description: A female orca off the coast of New Zealand.

item.title: 2 dead in Louisiana as tornadoes hit the South, leaving thousands without power
item.dc:creator: Patrick Smith
item.description: At least two people died as severe weather hit Louisiana overnight, with storms and tornadoes bringing devastation to southern states and leaving tens of thousands with damaged homes or severed power lines.

media:content.media:text: One dead in Louisiana as tornadoes hit the South, leaving thousands without power
media:content.media:description: Ed Sutton outside his destroyed trailer in Tallahassee, Fla., on May 13, 2024.

item.title: Congress blew the deadline for a plaque honoring Jan. 6 officers by over a year
item.dc:creator: Frank Thorp V and Rebecca Kaplan and Kyle Stewart and Ryan J. Reilly
item.description: Congress has missed a deadline to put up a plaque honoring law enforcement who fought to defend the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, by more than a year.

media:content.media:text: Speaker of the House Mike Johnson
media:content.media:description: A spokesperson said House Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., is working with the architect of the Capitol "to get the plaque mounted."

media:content.media:text: congressional award medal gold
media:content.media:description: The Congressional Gold Medal, awarded to those who responded to the Jan. 6, 2021, attack, on display at the exhibition hall of the Capitol Visitor Center on Monday.

item.title: Antony Blinken visits Ukraine to tout U.S. support for Kyiv's fight against Russia's advances
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday in an unannounced diplomatic mission to reassure Ukraine that it has American support as it struggles to defend against increasingly intense Russian attacks.

media:content.media:text: Blinken arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday in an unannounced diplomatic mission to reassure Ukraine that it has American support as it struggles to defend against increasingly intense Russian attacks.
media:content.media:description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy greets U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken in Kyiv on May 14, 2024.

item.title: Parishioners stop armed teen from entering Louisiana church
item.description: A teen armed with a rifle was stopped by parishioners as he attempted to enter Mass at an Abbeville, La., church. KLAF's Jim Hummel reports.

item.title: The 100 best moisturizers tested and ranked, according to editors
item.dc:creator: Lindsay Schneider and Select Staff
item.description: We tested more than 135 face moisturizers over 4 months. Shop the 100 best moisturizers now, including top contenders from Cerave, Cetaphil and Glossier.

media:content.media:text: We tried reliable drugstore favorites like Cetaphil and Neutrogena as well as popular luxe options from Tata Harper and Dermalogica.
media:content.media:description: We tried reliable drugstore favorites like Cetaphil and Neutrogena as well as popular luxe options from Tata Harper and Dermalogica.

media:content.media:text: After testing every editor submitted both qualitative and quantitative feedback for each moisturizer.
media:content.media:description: After testing every editor submitted both qualitative and quantitative feedback for each moisturizer.

media:content.media:text: 15+ opened moisturizer bottles
media:content.media:description: We gave more points to thick, unscented formulas, while moisturizers that were sticky or oily lost points.

media:content.media:text: Our editors paid close attention to the texture and scent of every formula.
media:content.media:description: Our editors paid close attention to the texture and scent of every formula.

media:content.media:text: Associate reporter Bianca Alvarez paid particular attention to how formulas interacted with her eczema.
media:content.media:description: Associate reporter Bianca Alvarez paid particular attention to how formulas interacted with her eczema.

media:content.media:text: Editorial director Lauren Swanson preferred thick moisturizers that combated any flaking or peeling she had from Accutane.
media:content.media:description: Editorial director Lauren Swanson preferred thick moisturizers that combated any flaking or peeling she had from Accutane.

media:content.media:text: We tried reliable drugstore favorites, like Cetaphil and La Roche-Posay, as well as bestsellers from popular brands like Glossier and Jones Road Beauty.
media:content.media:description: We tried reliable drugstore favorites, like Cetaphil and La Roche-Posay, as well as bestsellers from popular brands like Glossier and Jones Road Beauty.

item.title: Georgian parliament approves divisive Russia-style bill that sparked weeks of mass protests
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: The Georgian parliament on Tuesday approved in the third and final reading a divisive bill that sparked weeks of mass protests.

media:content.media:text: Georgian parliament approves divisive Russia-style bill that sparked weeks of mass protests
media:content.media:description: Georgian demonstrators protesting the controversial "foreign influence" near the parliament building in Tbilisi on Tuesday.

media:content.media:text: Georgia's parliament on Tuesday began the third and final reading of a divisive bill that sparked weeks of mass protests, with critics seeing it as a threat to democratic freedoms and the country's aspirations to join the European Union.
media:content.media:description: Georgian lawmakers fighting during a parliament session in Tbilisi on Tuesday.

item.title: Russia defense scandal deepens with arrest of new bribery suspect
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.description: The head of personnel at Russia’s Defense Ministry has been arrested on suspicion of bribery after more than $1 million in cash and valuables were discovered at his properties, investigators said on Tuesday.
